column4: where to go for support if a system won't boot with Live CD (Desktop x86 10.04 on Acer Travelmate)
ran md5sum on the iso before burning?
correct
cdrom first boot device in bios?
it is booting, showing Ubuntu logo, and after about 30 seconds black screen and nothing
i also tried restoring an image built on another machine to this Acer and it does the same thing (shows Ubuntu logo, then black screen and no disk activity)
no errors nothing, can    you change mode?
- I'll try - where/what to change?
, where it shows ubuntu log , should be option , press f4 to change mode
thanks.  It doesn't get that far.
oh ok, tried with usb boot?
no - attach USB drive to system and image that?
easy enough, I'll try

my black screen on boot issue seems to be X.  When I boot to recovery mode, I can boot it to a point where I can login through a console.  As soon as I "startx" screen goes black and hangs.  Is there a way to reconfigure X from that point?
hang on, i'll google.
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg ?
sounds familiar, i will try.  thanks!
you will have to restart x
found this thread, this is known and common issue with Acer laptops:  http://it.toolbox.com/blogs/securitymonkey/black-screen-on-boot-with-ubuntu-104-lucid-lynx-solution-38426
thank you
sorry, wrong link, it is http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1467798
